intro: Tetracera eriantha, commonly known as the white-flowered tetracera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are typically green when mature. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
